Username: Ái Linh Nguyễn LâmÁi Linh Nguyễn Lâm
Post Content:
A thorough review of contract validity in the Vietnamese legal system was given by Mr. Hung's talk show, with special attention to the crucial factors that affect a contract's enforceability. The basic principles of contract formation—which emphasize the importance of mutual agreement, legal capability, lawful subject matter, and correct form—were among the key ideas covered. The workshop also explored the subtleties of applying and interpreting these principles, especially in intricate situations including undue influence, pressure, or misrepresentation. The practical applications of these legal ideas and the significance of due diligence were highlighted by the real-world example of a contentious real estate transaction. Lastly, the topic of damages was covered, both inside and outside of contracts, with a distinction made between tortious behavior and contractual violations. Another major topic of discussion throughout the sharing was the remedies for contract violations. Vietnamese contract law provides a number of remedies, such as penalties, damages, specific performance, and contract termination. In particular, damages are typically the most sought-after remedy, meant to make up for the harm and put the harmed party back in the same situation as before the breach. Since Mr. Hung is an authority in this area, he provided us with a wealth of information and viewpoints that would enhance our legal understanding when it comes to entering into contracts and pursuing remedies when we find ourselves in precarious circumstances. As I think back on this session, I have a thorough understanding of contract law and how this type of agreement not only reduces legal risks but also fosters cooperation and mutual trust in business partnerships. The video's example presented a particular perspective on contract signing, which made it easier for me to see and comprehend how contract law concepts are used in practice under Vietnamese law. Username: Ái Linh Nguyễn LâmÁi Linh Nguyễn Lâm
Post Content:
A thorough review of contract validity in the Vietnamese legal system was given by Mr. Hung's talk show, with special attention to the crucial factors that affect a contract's enforceability. The basic principles of contract formation—which emphasize the importance of mutual agreement, legal capability, lawful subject matter, and correct form—were among the key ideas covered. The workshop also explored the subtleties of applying and interpreting these principles, especially in intricate situations including undue influence, pressure, or misrepresentation. The practical applications of these legal ideas and the significance of due diligence were highlighted by the real-world example of a contentious real estate transaction. Lastly, the topic of damages was covered, both inside and outside of contracts, with a distinction made between tortious behavior and contractual violations. Another major topic of discussion throughout the sharing was the remedies for contract violations. Vietnamese contract law provides a number of remedies, such as penalties, damages, specific performance, and contract termination. In particular, damages are typically the most sought-after remedy, meant to make up for the harm and put the harmed party back in the same situation as before the breach. Since Mr. Hung is an authority in this area, he provided us with a wealth of information and viewpoints that would enhance our legal understanding when it comes to entering into contracts and pursuing remedies when we find ourselves in precarious circumstances. As I think back on this session, I have a thorough understanding of contract law and how this type of agreement not only reduces legal risks but also fosters cooperation and mutual trust in business partnerships. The video's example presented a particular perspective on contract signing, which made it easier for me to see and comprehend how contract law concepts are used in practice under Vietnamese law. In summary, I was able to better understand contemporary legal procedures and pertinent contract law principles thanks to this sharing experience. hashtag#WSU hashtag#WesternSydneyVietnamhashtag#BusinessLaw

Username: Ái Linh Nguyễn LâmÁi Linh Nguyễn Lâm
Post Content:
A thorough review of contract validity in the Vietnamese legal system was given by Mr. Hung's talk show, with special attention to the crucial factors that affect a contract's enforceability. The basic principles of contract formation—which emphasize the importance of mutual agreement, legal capability, lawful subject matter, and correct form—were among the key ideas covered. The workshop also explored the subtleties of applying and interpreting these principles, especially in intricate situations including undue influence, pressure, or misrepresentation. The practical applications of these legal ideas and the significance of due diligence were highlighted by the real-world example of a contentious real estate transaction. Lastly, the topic of damages was covered, both inside and outside of contracts, with a distinction made between tortious behavior and contractual violations. Another major topic of discussion throughout the sharing was the remedies for contract violations. Vietnamese contract law provides a number of remedies, such as penalties, damages, specific performance, and contract termination. In particular, damages are typically the most sought-after remedy, meant to make up for the harm and put the harmed party back in the same situation as before the breach. Since Mr. Hung is an authority in this area, he provided us with a wealth of information and viewpoints that would enhance our legal understanding when it comes to entering into contracts and pursuing remedies when we find ourselves in precarious circumstances. As I think back on this session, I have a thorough understanding of contract law and how this type of agreement not only reduces legal risks but also fosters cooperation and mutual trust in business partnerships. The video's example presented a particular perspective on contract signing, which made it easier for me to see and comprehend how contract law concepts are used in practice under Vietnamese law. Username: Ái Linh Nguyễn LâmÁi Linh Nguyễn Lâm
Post Content:
A thorough review of contract validity in the Vietnamese legal system was given by Mr. Hung's talk show, with special attention to the crucial factors that affect a contract's enforceability. The basic principles of contract formation—which emphasize the importance of mutual agreement, legal capability, lawful subject matter, and correct form—were among the key ideas covered. The workshop also explored the subtleties of applying and interpreting these principles, especially in intricate situations including undue influence, pressure, or misrepresentation. The practical applications of these legal ideas and the significance of due diligence were highlighted by the real-world example of a contentious real estate transaction. Lastly, the topic of damages was covered, both inside and outside of contracts, with a distinction made between tortious behavior and contractual violations. Another major topic of discussion throughout the sharing was the remedies for contract violations. Vietnamese contract law provides a number of remedies, such as penalties, damages, specific performance, and contract termination. In particular, damages are typically the most sought-after remedy, meant to make up for the harm and put the harmed party back in the same situation as before the breach. Since Mr. Hung is an authority in this area, he provided us with a wealth of information and viewpoints that would enhance our legal understanding when it comes to entering into contracts and pursuing remedies when we find ourselves in precarious circumstances. As I think back on this session, I have a thorough understanding of contract law and how this type of agreement not only reduces legal risks but also fosters cooperation and mutual trust in business partnerships. The video's example presented a particular perspective on contract signing, which made it easier for me to see and comprehend how contract law concepts are used in practice under Vietnamese law. In summary, I was able to better understand contemporary legal procedures and pertinent contract law principles thanks to this sharing experience. hashtag#WSU hashtag#WesternSydneyVietnamhashtag#BusinessLaw

hashtag#day3 : javaGurugubelli Vijaya Kumar :trainer10000 Coders In Java, operators are special symbols that perform operations on variables and values. Java provides several types of operators:Arithmetic Operators: Used for basic arithmetic operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and modulus.Example: +, -, *, /, %Relational Operators: Used to compare two values. They return a boolean value (true or false).Example: ==, !=, >, <, >=, <=Logical Operators: Used to combine multiple boolean expressions.Example: && (AND), || (OR), ! (NOT)Assignment Operators: Used to assign values to variables.Example: =, +=, -=, *=, /=

Username: Ái Linh Nguyễn LâmÁi Linh Nguyễn Lâm
Post Content:
A thorough review of contract validity in the Vietnamese legal system was given by Mr. Hung's talk show, with special attention to the crucial factors that affect a contract's enforceability. The basic principles of contract formation—which emphasize the importance of mutual agreement, legal capability, lawful subject matter, and correct form—were among the key ideas covered. The workshop also explored the subtleties of applying and interpreting these principles, especially in intricate situations including undue influence, pressure, or misrepresentation. The practical applications of these legal ideas and the significance of due diligence were highlighted by the real-world example of a contentious real estate transaction. Lastly, the topic of damages was covered, both inside and outside of contracts, with a distinction made between tortious behavior and contractual violations. Another major topic of discussion throughout the sharing was the remedies for contract violations. Vietnamese contract law provides a number of remedies, such as penalties, damages, specific performance, and contract termination. In particular, damages are typically the most sought-after remedy, meant to make up for the harm and put the harmed party back in the same situation as before the breach. Since Mr. Hung is an authority in this area, he provided us with a wealth of information and viewpoints that would enhance our legal understanding when it comes to entering into contracts and pursuing remedies when we find ourselves in precarious circumstances. As I think back on this session, I have a thorough understanding of contract law and how this type of agreement not only reduces legal risks but also fosters cooperation and mutual trust in business partnerships. The video's example presented a particular perspective on contract signing, which made it easier for me to see and comprehend how contract law concepts are used in practice under Vietnamese law. In summary, I was able to better understand contemporary legal procedures and pertinent contract law principles thanks to this sharing experience. hashtag#WSU hashtag#WesternSydneyVietnamhashtag#BusinessLaw
